segment.source: MD Conversion - Help users connect to company networks using Wi-Fi profiles with Microsoft
segment.target: MD Conversion - Help users connect to company networks using Wi-Fi profiles with Microsoft

segment.source: MD Conversion - Help users connect to company networks using Wi-Fi profiles with Microsoft
segment.target: MD Conversion - Help users connect to company networks using Wi-Fi profiles with Microsoft

segment.source: Use Wi-Fi profiles to deploy wireless network settings to users and devices in your organization.
segment.target: Use Wi-Fi profiles to deploy wireless network settings to users and devices in your organization.

segment.source: These settings simplify connecting to wireless networks for end-users.
segment.target: These settings simplify connecting to wireless networks for end-users.

segment.source: For example:
segment.target: For example:

segment.source: You install a new Wi-Fi network named Contoso Wi-Fi and want to provision all devices that run the iOS operating system with the settings required to connect to this network.
segment.target: You install a new Wi-Fi network named Contoso Wi-Fi and want to provision all devices that run the iOS operating system with the settings required to connect to this network.

segment.source: You create a Wi-Fi profile containing the settings necessary to connect to the Contoso Wi-Fi wireless network.
segment.target: You create a Wi-Fi profile containing the settings necessary to connect to the Contoso Wi-Fi wireless network.

segment.source: You then deploy this profile to all users with iOS devices.
segment.target: You then deploy this profile to all users with iOS devices.

segment.source: Users find the new Contoso Wi-Fi network in the list of wireless networks and can easily connect to this network.
segment.target: Users find the new Contoso Wi-Fi network in the list of wireless networks and can easily connect to this network.

segment.source: You can deploy Wi-Fi profiles to the following platforms:
segment.target: You can deploy Wi-Fi profiles to the following platforms:

segment.source: Android 4.0 and later
segment.target: Android 4.0 and later

segment.source: iOS 7.1 and later
segment.target: iOS 7.1 and later

segment.source: Mac OS X 10.9 and later
segment.target: Mac OS X 10.9 and later

segment.source: Additionally, for devices that run Windows 8.1 and later, you can import a Wi-Fi configuration profile that was previously exported to a file.
segment.target: Additionally, for devices that run Windows 8.1 and later, you can import a Wi-Fi configuration profile that was previously exported to a file.

segment.source: For details, see Import a Wi-Fi configuration profile (Windows 8.1 and later only).
segment.target: For details, see Import a Wi-Fi configuration profile (Windows 8.1 and later only).

segment.source: Steps to create and deploy a Wi-Fi profile
segment.target: Steps to create and deploy a Wi-Fi profile

segment.source: Step 1: Create a Wi-Fi profile and supply general information
segment.target: Step 1: Create a Wi-Fi profile and supply general information

segment.source: In the Microsoft Intune administration console, click Policy > Add Policy.
segment.target: In the Microsoft Intune administration console, click Policy > Add Policy.

segment.source: Select one of the following policy types, and then click Create Policy:
segment.target: Select one of the following policy types, and then click Create Policy:

segment.source: Wi-Fi Profile (Android 4 and later)
segment.target: Wi-Fi Profile (Android 4 and later)

segment.source: Wi-Fi Profile (iOS 7.1 and later)
segment.target: Wi-Fi Profile (iOS 7.1 and later)

segment.source: Wi-Fi Profile (Mac OS X 10.9 and later)
segment.target: Wi-Fi Profile (Mac OS X 10.9 and later)

segment.source: There are no recommended settings for this policy type.
segment.target: There are no recommended settings for this policy type.

segment.source: You must create a custom policy.
segment.target: You must create a custom policy.

segment.source: Specify the following general values:
segment.target: Specify the following general values:

segment.source: Setting
segment.target: Setting

segment.source: More information
segment.target: More information

segment.source: Name
segment.target: Name

segment.source: Enter a unique name for the Wi-Fi profile to help identify it in the console.
segment.target: Enter a unique name for the Wi-Fi profile to help identify it in the console.

segment.source: Description
segment.target: Description

segment.source: Provide a description of the Wi-Fi profile that helps you to locate it.
segment.target: Provide a description of the Wi-Fi profile that helps you to locate it.

segment.source: Step 2: Configure network connection settings
segment.target: Step 2: Configure network connection settings

segment.source: Specify the Network Connections values:
segment.target: Specify the Network Connections values:

segment.source: Setting
segment.target: Setting

segment.source: More information
segment.target: More information

segment.source: Network name
segment.target: Network name

segment.source: Specify a descriptive name for the wireless network.
segment.target: Specify a descriptive name for the wireless network.

segment.source: This is the name that displays on a user’s device when they choose a wireless network.
segment.target: This is the name that displays on a user’s device when they choose a wireless network.

segment.source: SSID (Service Set Identifier)
segment.target: SSID (Service Set Identifier)

segment.source: Specify the (SSID) of the wireless network that you want devices to connect to.
segment.target: Specify the (SSID) of the wireless network that you want devices to connect to.

segment.source: The SSID is case-sensitive and is not displayed to users.
segment.target: The SSID is case-sensitive and is not displayed to users.

segment.source: Connect automatically when this network is in range
segment.target: Connect automatically when this network is in range

segment.source: Select this option to automatically connect devices to the wireless network when it is in range.
segment.target: Select this option to automatically connect devices to the wireless network when it is in range.

segment.source: Connect when the network is not broadcasting its name (SSID)
segment.target: Connect when the network is not broadcasting its name (SSID)

segment.source: Select this option to allow devices to connect to the network when it is not visible in the list of networks (because it is hidden and not broadcasting its name).
segment.target: Select this option to allow devices to connect to the network when it is not visible in the list of networks (because it is hidden and not broadcasting its name).

segment.source: Step 3: Configure security settings
segment.target: Step 3: Configure security settings

segment.source: Configure the Security Settings for the selected platform.
segment.target: Configure the Security Settings for the selected platform.

segment.source: The available settings depend on the security types you select.
segment.target: The available settings depend on the security types you select.

segment.source: For Android devices
segment.target: For Android devices

segment.source: Setting name
segment.target: Setting name

segment.source: More information
segment.target: More information

segment.source: Use when:
segment.target: Use when:

segment.source: Security type
segment.target: Security type

segment.source: Select the security protocol for the wireless network:
segment.target: Select the security protocol for the wireless network:

segment.source: WPA-Enterprise/WPA2-Enterprise
segment.target: WPA-Enterprise/WPA2-Enterprise

segment.source: No authentication (Open) if the network is unsecured.
segment.target: No authentication (Open) if the network is unsecured.

segment.source: Always
segment.target: Always

segment.source: EAP Type
segment.target: EAP Type

segment.source: Choose the Extensible Authentication Protocol (EAP) type used to authenticate secured wireless connections:
segment.target: Choose the Extensible Authentication Protocol (EAP) type used to authenticate secured wireless connections:

segment.source: EAP-TLS
segment.target: EAP-TLS

segment.source: PEAP
segment.target: PEAP

segment.source: EAP-TTLS
segment.target: EAP-TTLS

segment.source: You selected the WPA-Enterprise/WPA2-Enterprise security type.
segment.target: You selected the WPA-Enterprise/WPA2-Enterprise security type.

segment.source: Select root certificates for server validation
segment.target: Select root certificates for server validation

segment.source: Click Select, then choose the trusted root certificate profile used to authenticate the connection.
segment.target: Click Select, then choose the trusted root certificate profile used to authenticate the connection.

segment.source: To create the trusted root certificate profile, see Enable access to company resources using certificate profiles with Microsoft Intune.
segment.target: To create the trusted root certificate profile, see Enable access to company resources using certificate profiles with Microsoft Intune.

segment.source: Any EAP Type is selected.
segment.target: Any EAP Type is selected.

segment.source: Authentication method
segment.target: Authentication method

segment.source: Select the authentication method for the connection:
segment.target: Select the authentication method for the connection:

segment.source: Certificates to specify the client certificate
segment.target: Certificates to specify the client certificate

segment.source: Username and Password to specify a different method for authentication
segment.target: Username and Password to specify a different method for authentication

segment.source: The EAP type is PEAP or EAP-TTLS.
segment.target: The EAP type is PEAP or EAP-TTLS.

segment.source: Select a non-EAP method for authentication (Inner identity)
segment.target: Select a non-EAP method for authentication (Inner identity)

segment.source: Select how you will authenticate the connection:
segment.target: Select how you will authenticate the connection:

segment.source: None
segment.target: None

segment.source: Unencrypted password (PAP)
segment.target: Unencrypted password (PAP)

segment.source: Challenge Handshake Authentication Protocol (CHAP)
segment.target: Challenge Handshake Authentication Protocol (CHAP)

segment.source: Microsoft CHAP (MS-CHAP)
segment.target: Microsoft CHAP (MS-CHAP)

segment.source: Microsoft CHAP Version 2 (MS-CHAP v2)
segment.target: Microsoft CHAP Version 2 (MS-CHAP v2)

segment.source: The available options depend on the EAP type you selected.
segment.target: The available options depend on the EAP type you selected.

segment.source: The Authentication method is Username and Password.
segment.target: The Authentication method is Username and Password.

segment.source: Enable identity privacy (Outer Identity)
segment.target: Enable identity privacy (Outer Identity)

segment.source: Specify the text sent in response to an EAP identity request.
segment.target: Specify the text sent in response to an EAP identity request.

segment.source: This text can be any value.
segment.target: This text can be any value.

segment.source: During authentication, this anonymous identity is initially sent, and then followed by the real identification sent in a secure tunnel.
segment.target: During authentication, this anonymous identity is initially sent, and then followed by the real identification sent in a secure tunnel.

segment.source: The EAP type is PEAP or EAP-TTLS.
segment.target: The EAP type is PEAP or EAP-TTLS.

segment.source: Select a client certificate for client authentication (Identity Certificate)
segment.target: Select a client certificate for client authentication (Identity Certificate)

segment.source: Click Select, then choose the SCEP certificate profile used to authenticate the connection.
segment.target: Click Select, then choose the SCEP certificate profile used to authenticate the connection.

segment.source: To create a SCEP certificate profile, see Enable access to company resources using certificate profiles with Microsoft Intune.
segment.target: To create a SCEP certificate profile, see Enable access to company resources using certificate profiles with Microsoft Intune.

segment.source: The security type is WPA-Enterprise/WPA2-Enterprise, and any EAP type is selected.
segment.target: The security type is WPA-Enterprise/WPA2-Enterprise, and any EAP type is selected.

segment.source: For iOS and Mac OS X devices
segment.target: For iOS and Mac OS X devices

segment.source: Setting name
segment.target: Setting name

segment.source: More information
segment.target: More information

segment.source: Use when:
segment.target: Use when:

segment.source: Security type
segment.target: Security type

segment.source: Select the wireless network security protocol:
segment.target: Select the wireless network security protocol:

segment.source: WPA-Personal/WPA2-Personal
segment.target: WPA-Personal/WPA2-Personal

segment.source: WPA-Enterprise/WPA2-Enterprise
segment.target: WPA-Enterprise/WPA2-Enterprise

segment.source: WEP
segment.target: WEP

segment.source: No authentication (Open) if the network is unsecured.
segment.target: No authentication (Open) if the network is unsecured.

segment.source: Always
segment.target: Always

segment.source: EAP Type
segment.target: EAP Type

segment.source: Choose the Extensible Authentication Protocol (EAP) type used to authenticate secured wireless connections:
segment.target: Choose the Extensible Authentication Protocol (EAP) type used to authenticate secured wireless connections:

segment.source: EAP-TLS
segment.target: EAP-TLS

segment.source: PEAP
segment.target: PEAP

segment.target: EAP-TLS

segment.source: EAP-AST
segment.target: EAP-AST

segment.source: LEAP
segment.target: LEAP

segment.source: EAP-SIM
segment.target: EAP-SIM

segment.source: You selected a security type of WPA-Enterprise/WPA2-Enterprise.
segment.target: You selected a security type of WPA-Enterprise/WPA2-Enterprise.

segment.source: Trusted server certificate names
segment.target: Trusted server certificate names

segment.source: Select the trusted root certificate profile used to authenticate the connection.
segment.target: Select the trusted root certificate profile used to authenticate the connection.

segment.source: To create the trusted root certificate profile, see Enable access to company resources using certificate profiles with Microsoft Intune.
segment.target: To create the trusted root certificate profile, see Enable access to company resources using certificate profiles with Microsoft Intune.

segment.source: You selected an EAP type of EAP-TLS, PEAP, EAP-TTLS or EAP-FAST.
segment.target: You selected an EAP type of EAP-TLS, PEAP, EAP-TTLS or EAP-FAST.

segment.source: Use Protected Access Credential (PAC)
segment.target: Use Protected Access Credential (PAC)

segment.source: Select to use protected access credentials to establish an authenticated tunnel between the client and the authentication server.
segment.target: Select to use protected access credentials to establish an authenticated tunnel between the client and the authentication server.

segment.source: An existing PAC file is used if present.
segment.target: An existing PAC file is used if present.

segment.source: The EAP-type is EAP-FAST.
segment.target: The EAP-type is EAP-FAST.

segment.source: Provision PAC
segment.target: Provision PAC

segment.source: Provisions the PAC file to your devices.
segment.target: Provisions the PAC file to your devices.

segment.source: When used, you can also select Provision PAC Anonymously to ensure that the PAC file is provisioned without authenticating the server.
segment.target: When used, you can also select Provision PAC Anonymously to ensure that the PAC file is provisioned without authenticating the server.

segment.source: Use Protected Access Credential (PAC) is selected.
segment.target: Use Protected Access Credential (PAC) is selected.

segment.source: Authentication method
segment.target: Authentication method

segment.source: Select the authentication method used for the connection:
segment.target: Select the authentication method used for the connection:

segment.source: Certificates to specify the client certificate
segment.target: Certificates to specify the client certificate

segment.source: Username and Password to specify one of the following non-EAP methods for authentication (also known as Inner identity):
segment.target: Username and Password to specify one of the following non-EAP methods for authentication (also known as Inner identity):

segment.source: None
segment.target: None

segment.source: Unencrypted password (PAP)
segment.target: Unencrypted password (PAP)

segment.source: Challenge Handshake Authentication Protocol (CHAP)
segment.target: Challenge Handshake Authentication Protocol (CHAP)

segment.source: Microsoft CHAP (MS-CHAP)
segment.target: Microsoft CHAP (MS-CHAP)

segment.source: Microsoft CHAP Version 2 (MS-CHAP v2)
segment.target: Microsoft CHAP Version 2 (MS-CHAP v2)

segment.source: EAP-TLS
segment.target: EAP-TLS

segment.source: The EAP type is PEAP, or EAP-TTLS.
segment.target: The EAP type is PEAP, or EAP-TTLS.

segment.source: Select a client certificate for client authentication (Identity Certificate)
segment.target: Select a client certificate for client authentication (Identity Certificate)

segment.source: Select the SCEP certificate profile used to authenticate the connection.
segment.target: Select the SCEP certificate profile used to authenticate the connection.

segment.source: To create a SCEP certificate profile, see Enable access to company resources using certificate profiles with Microsoft Intune.
segment.target: To create a SCEP certificate profile, see Enable access to company resources using certificate profiles with Microsoft Intune.

segment.source: When the security type is WPA-Enterprise/WPA2-Enterprise and the EAP type is EAP-TLS, PEAP or EAP-TTLS.
segment.target: When the security type is WPA-Enterprise/WPA2-Enterprise and the EAP type is EAP-TLS, PEAP or EAP-TTLS.

segment.source: Enable identity privacy (Outer Identity)
segment.target: Enable identity privacy (Outer Identity)

segment.source: Specify text that sent in response to an EAP identity request.
segment.target: Specify text that sent in response to an EAP identity request.

segment.source: This text can be any value.
segment.target: This text can be any value.

segment.source: During authentication, this anonymous identity is initially sent, followed by the real identification sent in a secure tunnel.
segment.target: During authentication, this anonymous identity is initially sent, followed by the real identification sent in a secure tunnel.

segment.source: When the EAP type is set to PEAP, EAP-TTLS or EAP-FAST.
segment.target: When the EAP type is set to PEAP, EAP-TTLS or EAP-FAST.

segment.source: Step 4: Configure proxy settings (iOS and MAC OS X only)
segment.target: Step 4: Configure proxy settings (iOS and MAC OS X only)

segment.source: For iOS and Mac OS X Wi-Fi profiles, configure the following settings (if you are using a proxy server to help secure your network) under Proxy Settings:
segment.target: For iOS and Mac OS X Wi-Fi profiles, configure the following settings (if you are using a proxy server to help secure your network) under Proxy Settings:

segment.source: Setting name
segment.target: Setting name

segment.source: Moe information
segment.target: Moe information

segment.source: Use when:
segment.target: Use when:

segment.source: Proxy settings for this Wi-Fi connection
segment.target: Proxy settings for this Wi-Fi connection

segment.source: Choose the proxy settings type:
segment.target: Choose the proxy settings type:

segment.source: None (default)
segment.target: None (default)

segment.source: Manual - Manually specify the URL and port number of the proxy server.
segment.target: Manual - Manually specify the URL and port number of the proxy server.

segment.source: Automatic – Use a configuration file to configure the proxy server.
segment.target: Automatic – Use a configuration file to configure the proxy server.

segment.source: Always
segment.target: Always

segment.source: Proxy server address and Port number
segment.target: Proxy server address and Port number

segment.source: Specify the URL and port number of the proxy server.
segment.target: Specify the URL and port number of the proxy server.

segment.source: Proxy settings for this Wi-Fi connection is set to Manual
segment.target: Proxy settings for this Wi-Fi connection is set to Manual

segment.source: Proxy Server URL
segment.target: Proxy Server URL

segment.source: Specify the URL of the file containing the proxy server settings.
segment.target: Specify the URL of the file containing the proxy server settings.

segment.source: Proxy settings for this Wi-Fi connection is set to Automatic
segment.target: Proxy settings for this Wi-Fi connection is set to Automatic

segment.source: Step 5: Save the Wi-Fi profile
segment.target: Step 5: Save the Wi-Fi profile

segment.source: When you are finished, click Save Policy.
segment.target: When you are finished, click Save Policy.

segment.source: The new policy displays in the Configuration Policies node of the Policy workspace.
segment.target: The new policy displays in the Configuration Policies node of the Policy workspace.

segment.source: Step 6: Deploy the Wi-Fi profile
segment.target: Step 6: Deploy the Wi-Fi profile

segment.source: Deploy the Wi-Fi profile to one or more groups of users or devices in your organization.
segment.target: Deploy the Wi-Fi profile to one or more groups of users or devices in your organization.

segment.source: For more information about how to deploy policies, see Use policies to manage computers and mobile devices with Microsoft Intune.
segment.target: For more information about how to deploy policies, see Use policies to manage computers and mobile devices with Microsoft Intune.

segment.source: A status summary and alerts in the Policy workspace identify issues with the policy that require your attention.
segment.target: A status summary and alerts in the Policy workspace identify issues with the policy that require your attention.

segment.source: Additionally, a status summary appears in the Dashboard workspace.
segment.target: Additionally, a status summary appears in the Dashboard workspace.

segment.source: After successful deployment, users devices can automatically connect to the corporate wireless network you configured.
segment.target: After successful deployment, users devices can automatically connect to the corporate wireless network you configured.

segment.source: Import a Wi-Fi configuration profile (Windows 8.1 and later only)
segment.target: Import a Wi-Fi configuration profile (Windows 8.1 and later only)

segment.source: Use the Windows Wi-Fi Import Policy to import a set of Wi-Fi settings that you can then deploy to the required user or device groups.
segment.target: Use the Windows Wi-Fi Import Policy to import a set of Wi-Fi settings that you can then deploy to the required user or device groups.

segment.source: In Windows, you can use the netsh wlan utility to export an existing Wi-Fi profile to an XML file readable by .
segment.target: In Windows, you can use the netsh wlan utility to export an existing Wi-Fi profile to an XML file readable by .

segment.source: For example, to export a Wi-Fi connection named MyConnection to an XML file, type the following from a Windows command prompt:
segment.target: For example, to export a Wi-Fi connection named MyConnection to an XML file, type the following from a Windows command prompt:

segment.source: netsh wlan export profile MyConnection
segment.target: netsh wlan export profile MyConnection

segment.source: In the Microsoft Intune administration console, click Policy > Add Policy.
segment.target: In the Microsoft Intune administration console, click Policy > Add Policy.

segment.source: Configure a policy of the type Windows > Windows Wi-Fi Import Policy.
segment.target: Configure a policy of the type Windows > Windows Wi-Fi Import Policy.

segment.source: You can only create and deploy a custom Windows Wi-Fi import policy.
segment.target: You can only create and deploy a custom Windows Wi-Fi import policy.

segment.source: Recommended settings are not available.
segment.target: Recommended settings are not available.

segment.source: For more information about how to create and deploy policies, see the Use policies to manage computers and mobile devices with Microsoft Intune topic.
segment.target: For more information about how to create and deploy policies, see the Use policies to manage computers and mobile devices with Microsoft Intune topic.

segment.source: Specify the following general values for the Windows Wi-Fi Import Policy:
segment.target: Specify the following general values for the Windows Wi-Fi Import Policy:

segment.source: Setting name
segment.target: Setting name

segment.source: More information
segment.target: More information

segment.source: Name
segment.target: Name

segment.source: Enter a unique name for the Wi-Fi profile to identify it in the console.
segment.target: Enter a unique name for the Wi-Fi profile to identify it in the console.

segment.source: Description
segment.target: Description

segment.source: Provide a description w of the Wi-Fi profile and other relevant information that helps you to locate it.
segment.target: Provide a description w of the Wi-Fi profile and other relevant information that helps you to locate it.

segment.source: Specify the following values under the Custom Wi-Fi Profile heading:
segment.target: Specify the following values under the Custom Wi-Fi Profile heading:

segment.source: Setting name
segment.target: Setting name

segment.source: More information
segment.target: More information

segment.source: Configuration profile file
segment.target: Configuration profile file

segment.source: Click Import to select the XML file containing the Wi-Fi profile settings that you want to import into .
segment.target: Click Import to select the XML file containing the Wi-Fi profile settings that you want to import into .

segment.source: Custom configuration profile name (displayed to users)
segment.target: Custom configuration profile name (displayed to users)

segment.source: Displays the name of the Wi-Fi configuration profile as it will be shown to users on their device.
segment.target: Displays the name of the Wi-Fi configuration profile as it will be shown to users on their device.

segment.source: Configuration profile details
segment.target: Configuration profile details

segment.source: Displays the XML code for the configuration profile you selected.
segment.target: Displays the XML code for the configuration profile you selected.

segment.source: When you are finished, click Save Policy.
segment.target: When you are finished, click Save Policy.

segment.source: The new policy displays in the Configuration Policies node of the Policy workspace.
segment.target: The new policy displays in the Configuration Policies node of the Policy workspace.

segment.source: You can now use the information in Step 6 above to help you deploy the custom Wi-Fi profile.
segment.target: You can now use the information in Step 6 above to help you deploy the custom Wi-Fi profile.

segment.source: See Also
segment.target: See Also

segment.source: Enable access to company resources with Microsoft Intune - deleted
segment.target: Enable access to company resources with Microsoft Intune - deleted
